Posts.Content: catlover6294 wrote: I am 48 and recently went for my year checkup and my doctor did not mention finding anything when he did my breast exam.  Following my checkup, I went for my mammogram.  The tech performing the mammogram said that she saw something that was probably a cyst and did a more compressed mammogram.  She just said "yea".  I asked her if she thought it was cancer and she said no.  One week later I received a call from my OB/GYN's nurse stating for me to go have an ultrasound.  She also did not feel that there was any concern because my mammo rating was a 0.  I went for the ultrasound and the tech made the comment that it looked like mass of cyst, that she did not think it was cancer.  After the ultrasound was reviewed, it was suggested that I have a biopsy, so OB/GYN scheduled that.  Off I went to the general surgeon.  She looked at the mammogram and stated that to look at that, it did not look to bad and felt the area.  She said that it did not really feel like a lump but that the right breast was fuller in that area than the left.  She did the ultrasound which confirmed that it was not a cyst, it was solid so did the biopsy.  I asked her what her gut feeling was and she replied that when she can tell on an ultrasound that something is definitely cancer, she will tell the patient, but she is not sure with this.  She told me this several times.  I made the mistake of asking her should I be prepared for the result to be cancer and she said yes.  What a mixed message and of course I left there a wreck.  The mass did measure to be 2 cm.  I have not received the diagnosis yet but I have basically convinced myself that I have breast cancer and my death certificate is being signed.  There is not family history and I know that does not mean necessarily mean anything. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Very Very Nervous catlover6294 catlover6294
